The contrapositive of "If P, then Q" is "If not Q, then not P," and it is logically equivalent to the original statement. Therefore, if Mark did not buy the blue shirt, then we can conclude that Lisa did not buy the red shirt.

However, the statement "If Lisa did not buy the red shirt, then Mark did not buy the blue shirt" is not the contrapositive; it is the inverse of the original statement.
